plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular garden plants known for their brightly colored, densely petaled flowers. They bloom in late autumn and are often associated with fall floral displays.
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums symbolize longevity and rejuvenation in many cultures, especially in East Asia.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub that produces large, showy flowers in late autumn to early winter. Camellias are highly valued ornamentals in gardens and parks.
plants.bloomingSeason: October to March (peak in November to December)
plants.location: Eastern Asia (Japan, China) and cultivated worldwide in mild climates
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers were historically used in East Asia for tea and medicinal purposes before the tea plant was widespread.

plants.name: Brugmansia arborea
plants.description: A tropical shrub or small tree with large, fragrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom at night. Blooming occurs in tropical climates around November.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early winter (in frost-free tropical zones, can bloom in November)
plants.location: Andean regions of South America and tropical gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Brugmansia flowers are highly fragrant at night and attract moth pollinators.

plants.name: Rhododendron simsii
plants.description: Azaleas bloom profusely during cooler seasons in subtropical and tropical climates. Some species bloom in late autumn and early winter.
plants.location: Southeast Asia, cultivated worldwide in subtropical climates
plants.funFact: Azaleas are known for their dazzling flower displays and have been cultivated for thousands of years for ornamental use.
